intro: Crucifera juncea, commonly known as field mustard, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cross-shaped flowers and pod-like fruits. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats across temperate regions. The plant has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators. Its seeds are enclosed in siliques, which split open to release the seeds when mature. Field mustard is also known for its potential as a bioindicator plant due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
